intro: Chamaecytisus ratisbonensis, commonly known as the Ratisbon bush or evergreen broom, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and dry garden environments. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice for hedging and landscaping.
